title.value: Pharmacological inhibition of SLC6A19 lowers toxic phenylalanine burden in a PKU mouse model
title.justification: The paper's title explicitly states the focus on the pharmacological inhibition of SLC6A19 to reduce toxic phenylalanine burdens in a PKU mouse model.
title.quote: Pharmacological inhibition of SLC6A19 lowers toxic phenylalanine burden in a PKU mouse model

extractions.description: This study investigates the efficacy of pharmacological SLC6A19 inhibition in reducing plasma phenylalanine levels in a PKU mouse model. The research evaluates the impact of the SLC6A19 inhibitor JN-170 on different baseline phenylalanine levels modulated by dietary interventions.

type.justification: The study involves the experimental administration of a pharmacological inhibitor to test its effects on phenylalanine levels in mice, which is characteristic of empirical research.
type.quote: Here, we assess the preclinical efficacy of pharmacological SLC6A19 inhibition at different baseline Phe levels.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the pharmacological aspects of inhibiting a specific transporter to reduce phenylalanine levels.
The paper deals with phenylketonuria, a genetic disorder, and the genetic aspects of SLC6A19 function.
name.quote: Phenylketonuria (PKU) is characterized by toxic plasma concentrations of the neutral amino acid phenylalanine (Phe).

name.justification: The study looks into the toxicity of phenylalanine in the context of a genetic disorder and the effect of its reduction.
The paper investigates the effects of SLC6A19 inhibition using a mouse model specifically engineered to mimic PKU.
name.quote: In a mouse model of classical PKU, genetic loss of Slc6a19 lowers plasma Phe levels.

is_contributed.justification: The study uses an existing mouse model to explore its hypothesis rather than contributing a new model.
is_contributed.quote: In a mouse model of classical PKU

is_executed.justification: The model is used in the study to obtain experimental results.
is_executed.quote: Pharmacological inhibition of SLC6A19 in a PKU mouse model

is_compared.justification: The PKU mouse model is compared across different dietary conditions to assess baseline Phe levels.
is_compared.quote: Baseline plasma Phe levels were effectively modulated in Pah ^{enu2} mice fed diets with variable Phe content.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is mentioned and used but does not reference a specific paper for its introduction.
referenced_paper_title.quote: In a mouse model of classical PKU
